skill.name: ena-database
skill.description: Access European Nucleotide Archive via API/FTP. Retrieve DNA/RNA sequences, raw reads (FASTQ), genome assemblies by accession, for genomics and bioinformatics pipelines. Supports multiple formats.
skill.summary: Access European Nucleotide Archive via API/FTP. Retrieve DNA/RNA sequences, raw reads (FASTQ), genom...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown guides and API reference docs. No executable code, scripts, or local file access. The skill references only legitimate ENA public APIs at ebi.ac.uk. Network access to these endpoints is required for the documented use cases.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable nucleotide records can be slow and inconsistent. This skill guides precise ENA searches and downloads using official APIs and formats.
actual_capabilities: Explain ENA object types and accession usage
Provide Portal API query patterns for metadata searches
Describe Browser API endpoints for XML, FASTA, and EMBL retrieval
List filereport fields for download URLs and checksums
Summarize rate limits and retry guidance
limitations: Requires network access to ENA services
Subject to ENA rate limits of about 50 requests per second
Does not run local sequence analysis or alignment
Large file transfers require FTP or Aspera tools

use_cases.title: Pull study runs
use_cases.description: Find run accessions and download links for a study accession using Portal API searches.

use_cases.title: Automate metadata pulls
use_cases.description: Build scripted queries that return TSV or JSON metadata for pipeline ingestion.

use_cases.title: Verify taxonomy
use_cases.description: Check lineage and taxon IDs for organism metadata validation.

prompt_templates.title: List study samples
prompt_templates.prompt: List sample accessions for study PRJNA123456 and return TSV fields accession,sample_title.

prompt_templates.title: Fetch FASTQ links
prompt_templates.prompt: Use filereport to fetch fastq_ftp and fastq_md5 for run ERR123456 and summarize the results.

prompt_templates.title: Find assemblies
prompt_templates.prompt: Search assemblies for tax_tree(562) with contig_n50>=50000 and return accession and assembly_name.

prompt_templates.title: Taxonomy lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Get taxonomy details for taxon_id 562 and summarize lineage, rank, and scientificName.

output_examples.input: Find assemblies for E. coli with contig N50 over 50k and return key fields.
output: Returned assemblies for tax_tree(562) with contig_n50 above 50000
Use pagination if results exceed the limit

best_practices: Use Portal API for search and Browser API for direct record retrieval
Back off and batch requests when receiving HTTP 429
Prefer JSON or TSV when only metadata is needed
anti_patterns: Downloading large files through the API instead of FTP or Aspera
Parsing XML with regex instead of XML parsers

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is plain text and works in all three platforms.

faq.question: What limits apply to ENA requests?
faq.answer: ENA enforces about 50 requests per second and returns HTTP 429 on overuse.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides API patterns and fields suitable for scripted workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my local data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The content only references public ENA endpoints and formats.

faq.question: What should I do if a query fails?
faq.answer: Check parameters, handle HTTP status codes, and retry with backoff on 429 or 500 errors.

faq.question: How does this compare to direct ENA docs?
faq.answer: It summarizes endpoints, fields, and usage patterns so you can build queries faster.
